009package com.weather.sdk.model;
010
011import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonCreator;
012import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnoreProperties;
013import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
014import java.util.Objects;
015
016/**
017 * Represents temperature data including current temperature and perceived temperature.
018 *
019 * <p>This class encapsulates temperature information from the OpenWeatherAPI response, providing
020 * both the current temperature and the "feels like" temperature that accounts for factors like
021 * humidity and wind chill.
022 *
023 * <h2>Temperature Units</h2>
024 *
025 * <p>OpenWeatherAPI returns temperatures in Kelvin by default. This class provides convenience
026 * methods for conversion to Celsius and Fahrenheit.
027 *
028 * <h2>Temperature Characteristics</h2>
029 *
030 * <ul>
031 *   <li><strong>Current Temperature:</strong> The actual air temperature
032 *   <li><strong>Feels Like:</strong> The perceived temperature accounting for wind, humidity, etc.
033 * </ul>
034 *
035 * <h2>Usage Example</h2>
036 *
037 * <pre>
038 * Temperature temp = weather.getTemperature();
039 *
040 * // Get temperatures in Kelvin (API default)
041 * double current = temp.getTemp(); // 294.15K (21°C)
042 * double feelsLike = temp.getFeelsLike(); // 293.15K (20°C)
043 *
044 * // Convert to other units
045 * double celsius = temp.getTempCelsius(); // 21.0°C
046 * double fahrenheit = temp.getTempFahrenheit(); // 69.8°F
047 *
048 * // Check if temperature is comfortable
049 * if (temp.isComfortable()) {
050 *   System.out.println("Pleasant weather conditions");
051 * }
052 * </pre>
053 *
054 * @since 1.0.0
055 */
056@JsonIgnoreProperties(ignoreUnknown = true)
057public final class Temperature {
058
059  /** Comfortable temperature range minimum in Celsius. */
060  private static final double TEMP_COMFORT_MIN = 18.0;
061
062  /** Comfortable temperature range maximum in Celsius. */
063  private static final double TEMP_COMFORT_MAX = 24.0;
064
065  /** Freezing temperature threshold in Celsius. */
066  private static final double FREEZING_TEMP = 0.0;
067
068  /** Very hot temperature threshold in Celsius. */
069  private static final double VERY_HOT_TEMP = 35.0;
070
071  /** Temperature categories thresholds in Celsius. */
072  private static final double TEMP_COLD = 10.0;
073
074  /** Temperature categories thresholds in Celsius. */
075  private static final double TEMP_COOL = 18.0;
076
077  /** Temperature categories thresholds in Celsius. */
078  private static final double TEMP_MILD = 25.0;
079
080  /** Temperature categories thresholds in Celsius. */
081  private static final double TEMP_WARM = 30.0;
082
083  /** Temperature categories thresholds in Celsius. */
084  private static final double TEMP_HOT = 35.0;
085
086  /** The current temperature in Kelvin. */
087  @JsonProperty("temp")
088  private final double temp;
089
090  /** The perceived ("feels like") temperature in Kelvin. */
091  @JsonProperty("feels_like")
092  private final double feelsLike;
093
094  /**
095   * Constructs a new Temperature instance.
096   *
097   * @param temp the current temperature in Kelvin. Must be non-negative (absolute zero or above).
098   * @param feelsLike the perceived temperature in Kelvin. Must be non-negative.
099   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if either temperature is below absolute zero (0K)
100   */
101  @JsonCreator
102  public Temperature(
103      @JsonProperty("temp") final double temp, @JsonProperty("feels_like") final double feelsLike) {
104    if (temp < 0) {
105      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
106          "Current temperature must be non-negative (Kelvin), was: " + temp);
107    }
108    if (feelsLike < 0) {
109      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
110          "Feels-like temperature must be non-negative (Kelvin), was: " + feelsLike);
111    }
112
113    this.temp = temp;
114    this.feelsLike = feelsLike;
115  }
116
117  /**
118   * Returns the current temperature in Kelvin.
119   *
120   * @return the current temperature in Kelvin. Always non-negative.
121   */
122  public double getTemp() {
123    return temp;
124  }
125
126  /**
127   * Returns the perceived ("feels like") temperature in Kelvin.
128   *
129   * @return the feels-like temperature in Kelvin. Always non-negative.
130   */
131  public double getFeelsLike() {
132    return feelsLike;
133  }
134
135  /**
136   * Converts the current temperature to Celsius.
137   *
138   * @return the temperature in Celsius
139   */
140  public double getTempCelsius() {
141    return temp - 273.15;
142  }
143
144  /**
145   * Converts the feels-like temperature to Celsius.
146   *
147   * @return the feels-like temperature in Celsius
148   */
149  public double getFeelsLikeCelsius() {
150    return feelsLike - 273.15;
151  }
152
153  /**
154   * Converts the current temperature to Fahrenheit.
155   *
156   * @return the temperature in Fahrenheit
157   */
158  public double getTempFahrenheit() {
159    return (temp - 273.15) * 9 / 5 + 32;
160  }
161
162  /**
163   * Converts the feels-like temperature to Fahrenheit.
164   *
165   * @return the feels-like temperature in Fahrenheit
166   */
167  public double getFeelsLikeFahrenheit() {
168    return (feelsLike - 273.15) * 9 / 5 + 32;
169  }
170
171  /**
172   * Returns the temperature difference between actual and perceived temperature.
173   *
174   * @return the temperature difference in Kelvin (positive if feels warmer, negative if feels
175   *     cooler)
176   */
177  public double getTempDifference() {
178    return feelsLike - temp;
179  }
180
181  /**
182   * Indicates whether the temperature is considered comfortable for humans.
183   *
184   * <p>Comfortable temperature range is defined as 18-24°C (65-75°F).
185   *
186   * @return true if the temperature is in comfortable range, false otherwise
187   */
188  public boolean isComfortable() {
189    final double celsius = getTempCelsius();
190    return celsius >= TEMP_COMFORT_MIN && celsius <= TEMP_COMFORT_MAX;
191  }
192
193  /**
194   * Indicates whether the temperature is freezing or below.
195   *
196   * @return true if the temperature is 0°C or below, false otherwise
197   */
198  public boolean isFreezing() {
199    return getTempCelsius() <= FREEZING_TEMP;
200  }
201
202  /**
203   * Indicates whether the temperature is very hot.
204   *
205   * @return true if the temperature is 35°C or above, false otherwise
206   */
207  public boolean isVeryHot() {
208    return getTempCelsius() >= VERY_HOT_TEMP;
209  }
210
211  /**
212   * Returns a human-readable temperature description.
213   *
214   * @return a descriptive temperature category
215   */
216  public String getDescription() {
217    final double celsius = getTempCelsius();
218    final String result;
219
220    if (celsius < FREEZING_TEMP) {
221      result = "Freezing";
222    } else if (celsius < TEMP_COLD) {
223      result = "Cold";
224    } else if (celsius < TEMP_COOL) {
225      result = "Cool";
226    } else if (celsius < TEMP_MILD) {
227      result = "Mild";
228    } else if (celsius < TEMP_WARM) {
229      result = "Warm";
230    } else if (celsius < TEMP_HOT) {
231      result = "Hot";
232    } else {
233      result = "Very Hot";
234    }
235
236    return result;
237  }
238
239  /**
240   * Returns a formatted temperature string with unit.
241   *
242   * @param unit the temperature unit (K, C, or F)
243   * @return formatted temperature string
244   */
245  public String format(final char unit) {
246    double value;
247    String unitStr;
248
249    switch (Character.toUpperCase(unit)) {
250      case 'C':
251        value = getTempCelsius();
252        unitStr = "°C";
253        break;
254      case 'F':
255        value = getTempFahrenheit();
256        unitStr = "°F";
257        break;
258      default: // 'K'
259        value = temp;
260        unitStr = "K";
261        break;
262    }
263
264    return String.format("%.1f%s", value, unitStr);
265  }
266
267  @Override
268  public boolean equals(final Object obj) {
269    final boolean result;
270    if (this == obj) {
271      result = true;
272    } else if (obj == null || getClass() != obj.getClass()) {
273      result = false;
274    } else {
275      final Temperature that = (Temperature) obj;
276      result =
277          Double.compare(temp, that.temp) == 0 && Double.compare(feelsLike, that.feelsLike) == 0;
278    }
279    return result;
280  }
281
282  @Override
283  public int hashCode() {
284    return Objects.hash(temp, feelsLike);
285  }
286
287  @Override
288  public String toString() {
289    return String.format(
290        "Temperature{temp=%.1fK (%.1f°C), feelsLike=%.1fK (%.1f°C)}",
291        temp, getTempCelsius(), feelsLike, getFeelsLikeCelsius());
292  }
293}
